TopicTitle: Caterpillar Tracks- NOW OPEN SOURCE, ALL FILES OPEN TO PUBLIC

Articles.Content: The great news continues! Much gratitude to both you and 6.forty for all of your work bringing this to life!

A teeny tiny update, for teeny tiny tracks. For reference, that cylinder between the tracks is 0.5m

It should also be noted that unlike the giant tracks, these are one-sided tracks.

Edited March 16, 2014 by electronicfox
Wow the size difference is astounding, and keep up the great work.
Efox, you say these are unbreakable, Challenge accepted!! These updates are going to cost me a new keyboard due to all the drool. Looks most excellent.

A teeny tiny update, for teeny tiny tracks. For reference, that cylinder between the tracks is 0.5m

http://i.gyazo.com/b5b5c6e6075991c08f6e9f99b157ac99.png

http://i.gyazo.com/81e40dc74e523a2684da67abad7f9123.png

Seriously, thank you so much for the obvious hard work you're putting into these. I can't wait!

Efox, you say these are unbreakable, Challenge accepted!! These updates are going to cost me a new keyboard due to all the drool. Looks most excellent.

I say unbreakable...I mean not breakable in the way the stock wheels are they will still spontaneously disassemble upon striking a hard object at great speed.

The tracks are too black. I think it will be problematic to see them in the game. It can get quite dark and even in lamp light black will be black.

Remember: We perceive black because we can't perceive black.

Nevertheless I really like what you do.

The tracks are too black. I think it will be problematic to see them in the game. It can get quite dark and even in lamp light black will be black.

Remember: We perceive black because we can't perceive black.

Nevertheless I really like what you do.

Are you referring to the newest small tracks, or both new sets? If the former, they havent been textured properly yet (they just have a normal map on), if the latter, I'll keep this in mind.

I mean both sets.

Have a look at that:

I can't distinguish the chain links in the lower half. This shouldn't happen in broad daylight.

Maybe dark grey or 50% grey is the color to go.

I mean both sets.

Have a look at that:

http://i.gyazo.com/c7e18ef37bbfda3e084c18b7a8d58bd0.png

I can't distinguish the chain links in the lower half. This shouldn't happen in broad daylight.

Maybe dark grey or 50% grey is the color to go.

This is a very valid observation, thanks for that. I'll be giving them tracks a bit of a recolour, and keep this in mind for the future set too.
"coming soon" im doomed! if only it would be released now! still, great mod! its about time someone added actual content to the tracks mod!
Maybe make the tracks a little bit brighter, so you can see the patterns on them, and then make the metal between them a lighter shade of grey?

Since I don't yet have those new platforms to mess about with, I decided to duct tape my own platform together to test if the tracks would place nicely with each other in such a build:

Right... so, toggles for disabling/inverting individual treads. Need to get on that.

At least the plugin is getting closer to being suitable for public consumption. Basic movement works for single and dual tracks, but there are still some random bugs to work out.

I mean both sets.

Have a look at that:

http://i.gyazo.com/c7e18ef37bbfda3e084c18b7a8d58bd0.png

I can't distinguish the chain links in the lower half. This shouldn't happen in broad daylight.

Maybe dark grey or 50% grey is the color to go.

How do you already have these??? O.o
he's a dev

How do you already have these??? O.o

He doesn't. It's a repost of a picture in this post

How do you already have these??? O.o

Magic

I think I have to make one comment on the new large tracks - the level of detail does not seem to increase as much as its size. That makes them look a bit like inflated smaller tracks, if you get what I mean. Maybe some more intricate details would convey the size better, without adding too much polygons and such. A little detail in the right places does a lot.

Just a minor quibble

It should also be noted that unlike the giant tracks, these are one-sided tracks.

I like that!

Edited March 17, 2014 by Camacha

I think I have to make one comment on the new large tracks - the level of detail does not seem to increase as much as its size. That makes them look a bit like inflated smaller tracks, if you get what I mean. Maybe some more intricate details would convey the size better, without adding too much polygons and such. A little detail in the right places does a lot.

Just a minor quibble

I like that!

'nother good comment (I do welcome comments that also help make these look prettier). Little details arent my strong point, I often overlook them.

A teeny tiny update, for teeny tiny tracks. For reference, that cylinder between the tracks is 0.5m

It should also be noted that unlike the giant tracks, these are one-sided tracks.

http://i.gyazo.com/b5b5c6e6075991c08f6e9f99b157ac99.png

http://i.gyazo.com/81e40dc74e523a2684da67abad7f9123.png

I am curious what you mean by 'one sided'. Are you referring to the fact that you have to use two of them in unison or is it something else?

I am curious what you mean by 'one sided'. Are you referring to the fact that you have to use two of them in unison or is it something else?

The largest set of tracks contains both left and right reads, so these can balance without the aid of extra sets of tracks. The smaller set only has one tread, so you'll need to use symmetry in the spaceplace hangar, or some other wheels on the other side of the vehicle you attach them to.

The largest set of tracks contains both left and right reads, so these can balance without the aid of extra sets of tracks. The smaller set only has one tread, so you'll need to use symmetry in the spaceplace hangar, or some other wheels on the other side of the vehicle you attach them to.
